DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Specimen Availability Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no question related to the availability of a tumor tissue sample for clinical trial research purposes.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to access or readiness for use for a sample of tumor tissue composed of atypical neoplastic cells collected for research

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Available; obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are tissue samples available
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are tissue samples available for the indicated submissions

ReferenceDocuments.name: Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Tissue/sample available from prior to exceptional response?

ReferenceDocuments.name: text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there a tissue sample available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are archival tissue samples available for the indicated submissions

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must provide tissue from an archival tumor sample or newly obtained core, punch or excisional biopsy of a tumor lesion if deemed relatively safe and technically feasible. Note: Newly obtained biopsy is preferable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have adequate tumor specimen available for submission?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is tumor tissue available and able to be released for this patient, so that the specific and protocol-mandated correlative marker assays may be conducted?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have adequate tumor sample available for testing?
